doc.title: China Consumer Staples
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/China Consumer Staples Prepared food weak 2Q but divergent by scale product and input cost more rational competition int_2025-08-31

passages.text: Our prepared food companies are generally seeing a tough 2Q with bottom line missed, due to softer sales at - MSD% to +MSD% yoy growth, GPM contraction on pricing pressure and rising input costs, and higher selling for channel development, except for Angel Yeast and Ligao, where the former enjoys meaningful raw material tailwind and overseas white space and the latter captures favourable product cycle and proved its resilient margin profile amid rising input cost. Leaders continue to outperform versus peers eg Anjoy delivered c.6% yoy sales growth in 2Q25 vs national catering retail sales of c.4% yoy (above designated size at 2.6% yoy) and NPM stands at 7% while smaller frozen food player Qianwei missed GSe by 51% with sales/NP down 3%/42% yoy and Sanquan sales/OP missed by 2%/35% with sales/OP down 4%/39% yoy.

We presented a takeaway for horizontal comparison in Exhibit 2. We highlight key trend observed from our prepared food companies' comments: 1) sequential improvement into Aug albeit magnitude is still small; More new products are to be launched in 2H25; 2) stabilizing pricing trend noted in both small- to- B and major accounts, and companies generally would be more rational on the promotion or channel supports into 2H; 3) better performance recorded in 2C channel in 2Q which we attribute to more in- home consumption amid fluid catering; reformed KAs are now the key battlefields, while with tailor- made products and relatively high manufacturing cost, the margin is generally lower than Company average; 4) raw material cost trend divergent, and increases are mainly around protein eg beef and fish; companies do not expect further rising cost headwind in 2H.

Earnings revision and Valuation: Within this note, we raised Angel Yeast 24- 26E NP by 6%, to reflect 2Q25 beat and more positive margin outlook, and now we look for 10%/17% 24- 27E sales/NP CAGR. Maintain Buy with new TP of Rmb44.2 (prior Rmb40.0) still based on 20x 2026E exit PE but roll over to end- 2026 vs prior mid- 2026 (same for other companies). We reiterate our Buy rating on Anjoy and Ligao for the leading positioning to better capture the future sequential recovery (see our earning revision note here: Anjoy, Ligao); for other frozen food players, we trim our 25- 27E NP by 0- 36% to factor in softer than expected 2Q and more conservative outlook. Maintain Neutral on Sanquan and Qianwei, Sell on
The authors would like to thank Lily Qi's contribution to this note.
Exhibit 1:Prepared food earnings revision
Source: Company data, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 2: Briefing takeaways summary

Company2Q25/1H25 resultsCommentsComments for margin profileCompetition landscapeSales2CSmall 2BMajor 2BGPM and raw material costsNPMAnjoy2Q NPM missed on lower than expected GPM;Might commented that Jui sales remains under pressure, similar as Jun; but noted sequential improvement into AugMore 2C products to be launched in 2H, eg small packaged fresh lock products, sausage Roudouduo etcMight commented that Jui sales remains under pressure, similar as Jun; but noted sequential improvement into AugAnjoy already offers various designed frozen flour &amp; rice/frozen hotpot ingredients to large KAs including Sam's Club (in peak season), Yonghui, Hemaxiansheng and overseas (HK chained KA in Sep) etc.1H 25 GPM decreased by 3.3ppt yoy mainly on higher raw material prices (crayfish up by 30% yoy and fresh fish prices up by 15% yoy), rising manufacturing costs on new factories/equipment put in use and stronger promotion on wholesale prices on the back of weak catering demand.Maintain outperformance vs peers; prioritize market share gain and being flexible in pricing strategySanquan2Q OP missed on softer sales, lower GPM and higher SG&amp;A ratio;Strive to stick to its original sales/NP full year target at SD% yoy growth1H25: 2C sales down by 2.4%; Distributor sales decline narrowed to 1% but profits down by DD% due to increasing promotion costs; however margin control not expect further higher level into 2H1H25: small-B down DD% (mainly on pricing) and sales lower profit decline1H25: large-B was relatively more resilient as it mainly use customized products, with MSD's yoy growth1H25 a slight overall decrease in comprehensive raw material cost; pork, beef, glutinous rice, and black sesame with white other categories sales decline.Full year is expected to maintain broadly stable at 8-9%Company is seeing slow supply clearing due to good cash flow and government support; Company will focus more on innovative productsQianwei2Q NPM missed on softer sales, lower GPM and higher SG&amp;A ratio2Q NPM missed on softer sales, lower GPM and higher SG&amp;B ratioOnline: focus on two themes - breakfast and festivals.Company will make expenses more effective and encourage distributors to develop more catering clients.Exploring major accounts include Yonghui (reformed stores), Pangdonglai, Hema, Walmart (all format stores)GPM drop is partially due to the shift in product structure, with an increase proportion of lower GPM products. Sales of these products will continue to pressure on GPM will sustain but will be less;Stabilizing price trend in small 2B and major 2B notedWeizhixiang2Q NPM in line;Working on the store format reform, and saw store productivity DD% increase in 1H25; and will accelerate into 2HMight commented that Jui sales remains under pressure, similar as Jun; but noted sequential improvement into AugCollaborating with chained local KAs; one SKU could contribute a few million sales per yearGPM was mainly impacted by beef price; adjusted procurement and expect GPM to have some improvementLigao2Q NPM beat on higher GPM, and more disciplined admin cost ratio; sales broadly in line with GSeMight reiterated its DD% yoy sales for the full yearThe company is establishing a broader light cream portfolio with different pricing across value spectrum, to capture bakery shop's demand for value-in-money products.New from a bakery food in Sam's Club, and peak seasonsMight expects steadily improving GPM going forward, with 3Q in between 1Q and 2Q levelMight reiterated its HSD% NPM target for the full yearFor major KA, the company's R&amp;D capability and its ability to create high-quality supply are considered more relevant, unless a client intentionally diversifies suppliers for the same product2Q sales grew 18% yoy and NPM 8.0%, or 1.3ppt yoy expansion

We, Valrie Zhou, Leal Liu and Christina Liu, hereby certify that all of the views expressed in this report accurately reflect our personal views about the subject company or companies and its or their securities. Unless otherwise stated, the individuals listed on the cover page of this report are analysts in Goldman Sachs' Global Investment Research division.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Quantum is Goldman Sachs' proprietary database providing access to detailed financial statement histories, forecasts and ratios. It can be used for in- depth analysis of a single company, or to make comparisons between companies in different sectors and markets.

The rating(s) for Angel Yeast, Anjoy Foods Group (A), Anjoy Foods Group (H), Ligao Foods, Qianweiyangchu, Sanquan Foods and Weizhixiang is/are relative to the other companies in its/their coverage universe: Angel Yeast, Anhui Gujing Distillery Co., Anjoy Foods Group (A), Anjoy Foods Group (H), Budweiser APAC, Chacha Food Co., China Feihe Ltd., China Pet Foods, China Resources Beer, China Resources Beverage, Chongqing Brewery, Eastroc Beverage, Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food, Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food (H), Fuling Zhacai, Gambol Pet Group Co., Henan Shuanghui Ltd., Jiangsu Hengshun Vinegar, Jiangsu King's Luck Brewery, Jiangsu Yanghe, Jiugui Liquor, Jonjee Hi- Tech, Kweichow Moutai, Ligao Foods, Luzhou Laojiao, Mengniu Dairy, Nongfu Spring, Petpal Pet Nutrition Technology, Qianhe Condiment and Food, Qianweiyangchu, Sanquan Foods, Shanghai Bairun, Shanxi Xinghuacun Fen Wine, Sichuan Swellfun Co., Sichuan Teaway Food Group, Three Squirrels, Tingyi, Tsingtao Brewery (A), Tsingtao Brewery (H), Uni- President China, WH Group, Want Want China, Weizhixiang, Wuliangye Yibin, Yankershop Food, Yihai International Holding, Yili Industrial, ZJLD

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

Not Rated (NR). The investment rating, target price and earnings estimates (where relevant) are removed pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy when Goldman Sachs is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or in a strategic transaction involving this company, when there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints due to Goldman Sachs' involvement in a transaction, and in certain other circumstances. Early- Stage Biotech (ES). An investment rating and a target price are not assigned pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy when this company neither has a drug, treatment or medical device that has passed a Phase II clinical trial nor a license to distribute a post- Phase II drug, treatment or medical device. Rating Suspended (RS). Goldman Sachs Research has suspended the investment rating and price target for this stock, because there is not a sufficient fundamental basis for determining an investment rating or target price. The previous investment rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this stock and should not be relied upon. Coverage Suspended (CS). Goldman Sachs has suspended coverage of this company. Not Covered (NC). Goldman Sachs does not cover this company.
